title: Little Wings
about: "Little Wings" is VFP's third original production, directed by Naveen Mu. The Tamil-language short follows an elderly woman trapped in a bitter marriage who is pushed to the brink when her paralyzed husband sets out to consume her pet rooster. The film won multiple Best Film awards on the festival circuit, earned five Critics Choice Award nominations, and was the only Tamil short selected for the Indian Panorama at the 53rd International Film Festival of India. Its crowning achievement is winning the 71st Indian National Film Award for Best Cinematography (Non-Feature) in 2025 — a landmark honour that firmly established VFP's reputation in international independent cinema.

title: Small Wishes
about:
An ambitious young woman trapped in an archaic village decides to shed the limitations of her coveted long hair for a chance at a life on her own terms.

"Small Wishes" is VFP's second original production, co-directed by Santhosh Jay and Sabareesh Subramaniam, recipients of the second edition of the Iyackuddy Rabindran Short Film Fund. The Tamil-language short celebrates women's empowerment and the importance of education for women, using a simple yet powerful story to inspire change. It has gone on to screen at prominent international film festivals and achieve viral success online, furthering VFP's mission to champion impactful South Asian storytelling.

title: Untouchability
about:
One does not forget their caste, even when buying carrots.


In 2020, Viewfinder Film Productions (VFP) selected filmmaker Haresh Narayanan as the first recipient of the Iyackuddy Rabindran Short Film Fund, created in honour of VFP founder Dilani’s late father, a lifelong supporter of her passion for cinema. This collaboration resulted in “Untouchability” (“Theetu”)”, VFP’s first original production — a bold Tamil-language short exploring pressing social themes. The film premiered at prestigious festivals such as the UK Asian Film Festival, New York Indian Film Festival, and South Asian Film Festival of America, earning finalist recognition at the Swedish International Film Festival. Theetu set the foundation for VFP’s growth into producing globally celebrated South Asian stories.

title: Dinner Party
about: "Dinner Party" is VFP's fourth original production, filmed in Toronto in 2024, directed by Sabareesh Subramaniam & written by BC-based Payal Raj. The heartfelt short follows a young South Asian Canadian couple as they prepare a Diwali dinner for their families, only to have the evening unravel when a disagreement about starting a family comes to light. The film has screened at three international film festivals and is set for public release in 2025, continuing VFP's mission to tell authentic, culturally rooted stories that resonate with diverse audiences.
